content:
• Tuesday, April 9, 2019
  • IZEA

    IZEA +17.6% after double-digit bookings growth

    • IZEA Worldwide (NASDAQ:IZEA) is up 17.6% in postmarket trading after it reported first-quarter bookings that rose 18% year-over-year.
    • The online marketplace firm posted bookings of $7.8M vs. $6.6M a year ago.
    • Some 38% of those bookings came from a combination of software licensing and marketing spend, the company says, and software investments are paying off, CEO Ted Murphy says.
    • “SaaS Licensing Bookings increased 1,124% from Q1 last year," he notes. "Our SaaS licensing revenue committed under contract for 2019 is already 37% greater than that of all of 2018."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • APPS

    Digital Turbine -4% after $100M mixed shelf registration

    • Digital Turbine (NASDAQ:APPS) is 4% lower postmarket after the company filed a $100M mixed shelf registration.
    • The company filed to offer any combination of common stock, preferred stock, warrants, debt securities and units.
    • It intends to use any proceeds for general purposes, which could include "working capital, repaying, reducing or refinancing indebtedness, financing acquisitions of other companies that we believe will add to and/or expand our service offerings, repurchasing or redeeming our securities, investments, and capital expenditures."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 8 Comments
  • NVAX

    Novavax +5.4% on plan to present ResVax data

    • Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) is up 5.4% postmarket after announcing that its head of research and development will share data from its Phase 3 trial of ResVax next week at World Vaccine Congress.
    • ResVax is its respiratory syncytial virus fusion protein recombinant nanoparticle vaccine. The study failed to meet its primary endpoint in February.
    • The company's Dr. Gregory Glenn will give an oral presentation in Washington; the company's chief medical officer, Dr. Louis Fries III, will also take part in a panel discussion on chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
    • The oral presentation, titled "Phase 3 and beyond: The RSV F nanoparticle vaccine for infants via maternal immunization," will come Tuesday, April 16 at 3:40 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 15 Comments

  • After hours movers and shakers

    • Gainers: ATAI +29.3%. MRTX +3.1%. KALA +3.1%. HPE +2.4%. PKD +2.1%.
    • Losers: TWST -6.2%. PHAS -6.1%. AJRD -3.9%AMRS -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM

  • Notable earnings before Wednesday’s open

    • DAL, MSM
    • For Seeking Alpha's full earnings season calendar, click here.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue may announce trans-Atlantic routes - CNBC

    • JetBlue (NASDAQ:JBLU) +4% after-hours following a CNBC report that the airline appears to be gearing up to announce service across the Atlantic as soon as tomorrow, an expansion the company views an an opportunity to undercut entrenched rivals with its cheaper business-class service.
    • JBLU is scheduled to hold an "all hands" meeting with staff at JFK Airport along with "viewing parties" at some of its main hubs around the U.S. tomorrow afternoon, according to CNBC, citing an invitation it obtained.
    • The carrier reportedly may add service to London, but its plans could include other routes to European cities from its New York and Boston hubs.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • LEVI

    Levi's +2% after 1st post-IPO report

    • Shares of Levi's Strauss (NYSE:LEVI) are up 2.2% in AH trading following the company's first earnings report in its return to the public market.
    • The company reported positive growth in the Americas (+9%) business, Europe (+3%) and Asia (+8%) during FQ1.
    • Gross margin was 54.6% of sales vs. 54.9% a year ago.
    • Looking ahead, Levi's expects constant-currency net revenues growth at at mid-single digits rate for the full year and constant-currency adjusted EBIT margin to be flat-to-slightly up.
    • Shares of Levi's are trading about 30% over where the IPO was priced.
    • Previously: Levi Strauss reports Q1 results (April 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • PHAS

    PhaseBio files for equity offering; shares down 6% after hours

    • PhaseBio Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PHAS) has filed a prospectus for a public offering of 3M common shares. Pricing has yet to be determined.
    • Shares are off 6% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • PTE

    PolarityTE down 10% after hours on equity offering

    • PolarityTE (NASDAQ:PTE) slips 10% after hours in reaction to its public stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 11 Comments
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart EPS in-line, misses on revenue

    • PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.88; GAAP EPS of $0.79 in-line.
    • Revenue of $854.43M (+1.8% Y/Y) misses by $5.5M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PCG

    More wildfires PG&E’s next big risk, Morgan Stanley analyst says

    • Potential liabilities for future wildfire outbreaks are the next worry for PG&E (PCG -4.6%) shareholders, Morgan Stanley warns in reiterating its Equal Weight rating and $17.50 price target.
    • "Even a large insurance fund would, on its own, be insufficient to incentivize institutional investors to provide badly needed capital to PG&E in the future," Stanley analyst Stephen Byrd writes.
    • While a wet winter may help to prevent a repeat of last year's disaster, the firm says fires are unlikely to disappear from the California landscape, and the state's inverse condemnation law means that companies could be on the hook for fires started by their equipment even if they are not found to be negligent.
    • Byrd notes the California Public Utilities Commission last week proposed a version of a stress test that would examine a utility's ability to weather a heavy financial blow and seeks to make sure utilities can help pay for fire damage without having their debt downgraded to junk, making it harder for them to raise funds.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 10 Comments
  • AR

    Antero Resources -5% as Cowen says hedging advantage eroding

    • Antero Resources (AR -4.8%) tumbles as Cowen initiates coverage with a Market Perform rating and $11 price target, noting that as a higher-cost producer with excessive firm transportation, the firm sees more challenged returns beyond the highly hedged 2019 period that will make cash flow growth challenged into 2020, below $2.85/Mcf gas pricing.
    • With a less competitive free cash yield, the firm sees limited upside near-term.
    • At the same time, Cowen starts Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +0.9%) with an Outperform rating and $32 price target, saying the company's Atlantic Sunrise pipeline project provides visibility to a solid growth outlook.
    • COG leverages one of the lowest cost structures among exploration and production companies and its margins continue to improve with pipeline additions, Cowen says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 58 Comments
  • AEGN

    Aegion subsidiary awarded $5M wastewater rehabilitation project

    • Aegion (AEGN -2.5%) subsidiary, Insituform Technologies, LLC has been awarded a contract valued at $5M from the City of Phoenix, Arizona to complete the rehabilitation of over 32 miles of 8- to 15-inch wastewater pipelines using Insituform® CIPP.
    • Work on the project is expected to begin in mid-2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • FARO

    Technology movers and shakers

    • Gainers: FARO Technologies (NASDAQ:FARO) +18%. Orion Energy Systems (NASDAQ:OESX) +11%. Cerner Corporation (NASDAQ:CERN) +10%. Fang Holdings (NYSE:SFUN) +8%. SITO Mobile (NASDAQ:SITO) +8%.
    • Losers: Pareteum Corporation (NASDAQ:TEUM) -8%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -7%. Summit Wireless Technologies (NASDAQ:WISA) -7%. DropCar (NASDAQ:DCAR) -7%. Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 4 Comments
  • FCX

    Freeport sees no dividend hikes, M&A while focusing on Grasberg, CEO says

    • Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.8%) plans no dividend raises, acquisitions or debt buybacks over the next two years, CEO Richard Adkerson says at the World Copper Conference in Santiago, Chile.
    • Adkerson says FCX wants to focus on expanding its Grasberg copper and gold mine underground for two years, then the company would be "well situated to then look at further debt reductions, potentially higher dividends, potential investments in new projects, and we’ll be open to seeing if there’s anything in the global M&A market that meets our objectives."
    • The CEO also dismisses the suggestion by some investors that FCX should be split up, with its Indonesian operations separated from mines in the Americas, citing "real advantages in our current structure, as we're able to bring the global technological capability of the whole company to bear in Indonesia."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 24 Comments

  • Amyris and Rosehill Resources among Energy/Materials gainers; Quintana Energy Services and Key Energy Services losers

    • Gainers: Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) +12%. Rosehill Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) +11%.
    • Losers: Quintana Energy Services (NYSE:QES) -12%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) -11%. United States Steel (NYSE:X) -9%. Superior Drilling Products (NYSEMKT:SDPI) -7%. Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM

  • Yangtze River Port and Logistics the only financial gainer; China Internet Nationwide Financial Services and Grupo Supervielle only losers

    • Gainers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) +5%.
    • Losers: China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) -7%. Grupo Supervielle (NYSE:SUPV) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM

  • Under Armour -4% after B. Riley warning

    • Shares of Under Armour (UA, UAA) after B. Riley highlights slowing consumer appreciation as part of a note reiterating a Sell rating.
    • The firm says its recent survey showed Under Armour ranking fifth in basketball footwear, sixth in running shoes and seventh in casual footwear. Under Armour stayed in third in apparel behind Nike and Adidas.
    • "This is concerning given footwear is one of Under Armour’s growth vehicles. We believe this is reflective of the limited innovation we have seen in Under Armour footwear compared with Nike and Adidas," writes analyst Susan Anderson.
    • B. Riley has a price target of $12 on UAA.
    • UA -4.00%. UAA -4.42%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 9 Comments

  • Fuel Tech only industrial gainers; Pentair and Hollysys Automation among losers

    • Gainers: Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK) +9%.
    • Losers: Hollysys Automation Technologies (NASDAQ:HOLI) -24%. Pentair (NYSE:PNR) -15%. Lindsay (NYSE:LNN) -8%. Attis Industries (NASDAQ:ATIS) -7%. Forterra (NASDAQ:FRTA) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 3 Comments

  • FARO, HOLI, ZGNX and FIXX among notable midday movers

    • Gainers: ATA (NASDAQ:ATAI) +97%. Provention Bio (NASDAQ:PRVB) +29%. PhaseBio Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PHAS) +24%. Chimerix (NASDAQ:CMRX) +22%. FARO Technologies (NASDAQ:FARO) +17%. Soliton (NASDAQ:SOLY) +15%. GEE Group (NYSEMKT:JOB) +14%. Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) +12%. Rosehill Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) +12%. Netshoes (NYSE:NETS) +10%.
    • Losers: Vaxart (NASDAQ:VXRT) -36%. Zosano Pharma (NASDAQ:ZSAN) -24%. Hollysys Automation Technologies (NASDAQ:HOLI) -23%. Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) -23%. Dare Bioscience (NASDAQ:DARE) -21%. Outlook Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OTLK) -19%.Pentair (NYSE:PNR) -15%. Novartis AG (NYSE:NVS) -12%.Homology Medicines (NASDAQ:FIXX) -11%. Niu Technologies (NASDAQ:NIU) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • PCG

    PG&E, DTE cited for failing to protect against cyber attacks - WSJ

    • PG&E (PCG -3.5%) and DTE Energy (DTE +0.2%) were among utilities that broke rules designed to protect the U.S. electric system from cyber and physical attacks and were sanctioned by federal regulators, WSJ reports, citing newly released documents that provided the identities of the violators.
    • The identification of the violators follows February reports that Duke Energy broke the same set of rules.
    • The cases against and PG&E, DTE and City Utilities of Springfield, Mo., were lodged during 2014-16, a time when U.S. officials say Russia was conducting a major campaign to penetrate utility defenses.
    • The newly revealed cases raise questions about the current system designed to encourage self-disclosure from the utilities by keeping the names of violators quiet.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • OKTA

    Okta +5% as Berenberg sees new upside

    • Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) gains 5% after Berenberg says the company's new advanced server access products are a key growth driver that will open a new market and expand "the opportunity for every account."
    • The firm left Okta's recent user conference "confident that this is only the early phase of large enterprise adoption of the Okta platform."
    • Rating maintained at Buy with a $92 PT.
    • Previously: Okta +4% on analyst day praise (April 3)
    • Previously: Okta gains on new Street-high target (April 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 10 Comments
  • GOOG

    Elastic, MongoDB gain on Google partnership

    • Google (GOOG -0.6%)(GOOGL -0.5%) Cloud Platform adds managed services from new open source partners MongoDB (MDB +4.2%), Elastic (ESTC +2.5%), DataStax, InfluxData, Neo4j, Redis Labs, and Confluent, which counts Microsoft as a stakeholder.
    • The move counters rival Amazon's tendency to package open-source projects under its own brand often without giving back to the original project, which caused a scuffle with MongoDB.
    • In other news from Google Cloud Next, the company will bring two new data center locations online in 2020: Seoul, South Korea and Salt Lake City, Utah. Google has a total of 15 regions and 45 zones.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 6 Comments

  • Iconix Brand Group and New Age Beverages among consumer losers

    • Gainers: None
    • Losers: Niu Technologies (NASDAQ:NIU) -11%. KBS Fashion Group (NASDAQ:KBSF) -9%. New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) -7%. Iconix Brand Group (NASDAQ:ICON) -6%. Superior Industries International (NYSE:SUP) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • SNMSF

    Spin Master points to strong upside on D.A. Davidson

    • Shares of Spin Master (OTC:SNMSF) trades 1.5% higher in Toronto after D.A. Davidson launched coverage on the toy seller with a Buy rating.
    • The investment firm thinks Spin Master has high organic growth potential and interesting tech/IP upside.
    • D.A. Davidson's price target of C$51 reps 33% upside potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • WIFI

    Boingo Wireless deploys Wi-Fi 6 at John Wayne Airport

    • Boingo Wireless (WIFI +3.4%) has deployed Wi-Fi 6 at John Wayne Airport in Orange County, Calif.
    • That's the first known deployment of the next-gen wireless networking standard at a major airport, the company believes.
    • Wi-Fi 6 is based on the 802.11ax standard (with a newer, simpler name).
    • Boingo deployed its system with Cisco equipment and tested it with Samsung Galaxy phones; the Samsung Galaxy S10 si the first family of smartphones with Wi-Fi 6 support.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM

  • CEL-SCI and SELLAS Life Sciences among healthcare gainers; Zogenix and Dare Bioscience among losers

    • Gainers: PhaseBio Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PHAS) +24%. Chimerix (NASDAQ:CMRX) +22%. CEL-SCI (NYSEMKT:CVM) +20%. Provention Bio (NASDAQ:PRVB) +18%. SELLAS Life Sciences (NASDAQ:SLS) +11%.
    • Losers: Vaxart (NASDAQ:VXRT) -36%. Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) -24%. Zosano Pharma (NASDAQ:ZSAN) -24%. Dare Bioscience (NASDAQ:DARE) -23%. Outlook Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OTLK) -20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • NLSN

    Nielsen jumps 3% on report sale could come next week

    • Nielsen Holdings (NYSE:NLSN) has spiked 3% as StreetInsider reports a long-running sales drama may come to an end as soon as next week with a deal announcement.
    • CNBC said Friday that Advent International was teaming up with Goldman Sachs on a bid, and Apollo Global Management was also reportedly working on an offer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMBR

    Amber Road pushes back on Altai nominations

    • Amber Road (NYSE:AMBR) stakeholder Altai Capital Management nominates two board candidates for potential election at the annual meeting on May 7. Altai cites concerns with AMBR's "irresponsible handling" of last year's E2open acquisition proposal and its "egregious executive compensation."
    • Amber Road sent out a letter asking shareholders to vote for the company's board candidates.
    • AMBR says Altai pressured the company to sell to E2open without fully disclosing Altai's economic interest in the firm.
    • Key quote: "Altai Capital Osprey ... is attempting to derail our progress by electing its own nominees to the Board to pursue Altai's agenda that we believe is misaligned with the interests of the rest of our stockholders."
    • Amber Road shares are up 1.5% to $8.82.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM

  • LG +3% on Apple shift to mini LEDs - Kuo

    • Noted Apple (AAPL +1%) analyst Ming-Chi Kuo predicts the company will shift to mini LED displays for its computers and tablets over the next two years.
    • Mini LED backlighting could appear in the 31.6-inch iMac coming in Q2 or Q3 2019, a 10- to 12-inch iPad coming in Q4 2020 or Q1 2021, and a 15- to 17-inch MacBook in H1 2021.
    • The LCD panels will come from LG Display (NYSE:LPL).
    • While Apple has moved its phones over to OLED screens, larger OLED displays are cost prohibitive. Mini LEDs offer a thinner panel and better picture quality than traditional LCDs with a lower price tag.
    • LPL shares are up 2.9% to $9.43.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 9 Comments
  • SJR

    Shaw dips as Q2 beats despite lower revenue

    • Shaw Communications (SJR -2.2%) topped expectations in its Q2 report as it reported postpaid subscriber growth but saw revenues dip year-over-year paced by a drop in Wireless.
    • Revenues dropped to C$1.32B from C$1.33B, with the drop in Wireless coming to 6.4%, led by a 40% drop in equipment revenue.
    • The company swung to a net profit of C$155M from a year-ago loss of C$175M.
    • Free cash flow came to C$160M, vs. a prior-year C$124M.
    • Wireless postpaid net subscriber additions came to 65,000, bringing the Freedom Mobile customer base to over 1.5M by February's end.
    • Revenue by segment: Wireline consumer, C$923M (down 0.3%); Wireline business, C$148M (up 5.7%); Wireless Service, C$169M (up 26.1%); Wireless equipment, C$78M (down 40%).
    • It's on track to meet fiscal 2019 guidance, including consolidated operating income before restructuring costs/amortization up 4-6% Y/Y; capital investments of about C$1.2B; and free cash flow over $500M.
    • Previously: Shaw Communications beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Apr. 09 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • BA

    Goldman cuts PT on Boeing, says no 737 Max deliveries in Q2

    • Shares of the U.S. planemaker are down another 1.1% today as Goldman Sachs became the latest to lower its PT on Boeing (NYSE:BA), which it rates at Neutral.
    • "We revise our 12-month price target to $393 from $425 which reflects the flow through of our reduced estimates, still based on 18.7X CY19E P/E. We have also revised our core 2021-2023 EPS estimates to $25.91/29.43/32.17 from $26.81/29.30/33.47 to reflect changes in the 737 ramp. Key risks: (1) the pace of air traffic growth, (2) 737 MAX reliability, (3) DoD spending priorities."
    • "For this year, we assume no MAX deliveries in 2H March and all of 2Q 2019, but that all of those deliveries catch up in 2H19."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 21 Comments
  • AJRD

    Aerojet -11% as Spruce Point sees up to 60% downside

    • Aerojet Rocketdyne (NYSE:AJRD) sinks as much as 11% after Spruce Point Management places a "Strong Sell" on shares.
    • "In our opinion, Aerojet Rocketdyne is facing fundamental pressures, masked by complicated and aggressive accounting, which gives investors a potentially misleading impression of stability and growth."
    • "While holding no conference calls, and having only four analysts cover the stock, we believe the market is fundamentally ignoring ~$900M of liabilities associated with the business, making the Company 5x more levered than it appears and its valuation 'cheap.'"
    • "Furthermore, analysts blindly pencil in 4% revenue growth in the next two years, despite hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue programs that are disappearing. We see 40%-60% downside once investors piece the puzzle together."
    • Check out the full report here
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 11 Comments
  • APRN

    Investors bid up Blue Apron again

    • Blue Apron (NYSE:APRN) is up 6.15% in morning trading to continue a week-long uptrend in share price since the company announced a new CEO and backed its prior guidance.
    • Shares of Blue Apron are now up 16% over the last five sessions.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVYA

    Cowen: Leveraged buyout might make sense for in-transition Avaya

    • Reports that Avaya Holdings (AVYA +3.4%) is looking at an auction process after unsolicited interest have Cowen nodding along.
    • A leveraged buyout "could make sense, given the company’s top-line transition is not occurring quickly or visibly enough to satisfy public market investors," the firm's Lance Vitanza says. He's bullish with a $29 price target (58% upside) based on Avaya staying independent, and notes it's a company with long-term secular pressure on its legacy business and near-term headwinds from a ramping cloud-based business. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Avaya is reportedly looking for bids by the end of the month; potential bidders include Apollo Global Management, Permira Holdings and Searchlight Capital Partners.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • BIOS

    FDA warns BioScrip on sterility of drug products

    • The FDA has sent a Warning Letter to BioScrip (BIOS -3.1%) subsidiary Infusion Partners, LLC concerning deficiencies in its sterile drug product production at its Canfield, OH facility. The letter cites unsanitary conditions that could contaminate products and put patients at risk.
    • The company must submit its corrective action plan within 15 working days or face more serious action from the agency.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM

  • Sports Direct +2% after Debenhams development

    • Sports Direct International (OTCPK:SDIPF, OTCPK:SDISY) issues a formal statement indicating that it does not intend to make an offer to acquire Debenhams.
    • The statement follows Debenham's announcement that administrators have been appointed to take control of the retailer.
    • Shares of Sports Direct are up 2.42% in London trading.
    • Previously: Debenhams to close stores as lenders grab control (April 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • TEUM

    Pareteum moves seven new customers into production

    • Pareteum (TEUM -4.3%) launched seven new customers into production during March, it says.
    • That brings the three-month 2019 total to 15 new customers deployed into commercial service.
    • The seven new customers include mobile virtual network operators migrating to the Pareteum cloud platform as well as using API interfaces to the platform, along with mobility and security solution providers
    • The company notes that for the first quarter, it brought 36-month contractual revenue backlog to a total of $938M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 19 Comments
  • OTLK

    Outlook files for downsized equity offering; shares off 11%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Outlook Therapeutics (OTLK -10.7%) has filed a prospectus for $25M equity offering consisting of ~4.1M shares of common stock, 15-month warrants to purchase up to the same number of shares and five-year warrants to purchase up to the same number of shares.
    • Last month, the company filed for a $50M offering of ~7.1M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 5 Comments
  • LRCX

    Semi equipments slip on bearish Goldman note

    • Goldman Sachs analyst Toshiya Hari says the firm is increasingly negative on memory spending and thinks investor expectations for an H2 wafer fab equipment recovery will fade.
    • The analyst expects semi equipment companies to revise their WFE forecasts over the next few months and for analysts to cut earnings estimates. Goldman now expects the WFE market to drop 25% Y/Y compared to its previous -20% Y/Y forecast.
    • Goldman reinstated KLA at Sell this morning and remains Neutral on Lam Research (LRCX -1.4%), Applied Materials (AMAT -1.7%), and semi caps broadly.
    • Other semi equipment names that could move on the note: IPG Photonics (IPGP -1.5%), Teradyne (TER -0.8%), Cree (CREE -1%), Entegris (ENTG -0.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 15 Comments
  • CERN

    Evercore steps up to Cerner sideline

    • Evercore ISI upgrades Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN) from Underperform to In-line and raises the target from $52 to $64, implying a 12% upside.
    • Earlier today, Cerner announced reaching a board pact with activist investor Starboard Value and added $1.2B to its share buyback program.
    • Cerner shares are up 11% pre-market to $63.45.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM

  • Wynn-Crown deal talks said to be over

    • Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) has cut off all talks with Crown Resorts (OTCPK:CWLDF) about a merger after the deal talks leaked to the media, according to CNBC.
    • Shares of Wynn are down 1.0% in premarket trading.
    • Previously: Wynn Resorts makes $7.1B offer for Australia’s Crown Resorts (April 8)
    • Previously: Wynn Resorts seen playing defense with Crown pursuit (April 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 16 Comments
  • ZSAN

    Zosano down 26% on pricing equity offering

    • Zosano Pharma (NASDAQ:ZSAN) prices public offering of common stock for gross proceeds of $17.5M.
    • Underwriters over-allotment is $2.625M additional shares.
    • Net proceeds will be used for development and commercialization of Qtrypta (M207), and for working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Closing date is April 11.
    • Shares are down 26% premarket.
    • Previously: Zosano down 18% after hours on equity offering (April 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • NTCT

    NetScout -3.4% on preliminary Q4 results

    • NetScout (NASDAQ:NTCT) reports preliminary Q4 revenue of $235M, about $15M below expectations and missing the $249.2M consensus. The reduction was primarily due to delayed revenue recognition on a large project for a mobile operator.
    • The company expects the revenue to be recognized over the next several quarters.
    • Q4 EPS straddles consensus with $0.59 to $0.64 compared to the $0.61 estimate.
    • NTCT shares are down 3.4% pre-market to $27.41.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • RARX

    Ra Pharma finalizing design of Phase 3 zilucoplan study in myasthenia gravis; shares up 2% premarket

    • Ra Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RARX) is up 2% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement that it has completed its End-of-Phase 2 interactions with the FDA and is putting the finishing touches on a pivotal Phase 3 study evaluating zilucoplan in patients with generalized myasthenia gravis (gMG), an autoimmune disorder characterized by weakness in the skeletal muscles.
    • The trial, expected to launch in H2, will assess a once-daily self-administered subcutaneous dose of 0.3 mg/kg of zilucoplan compared to placebo in ~130 gMG subjects who are acetylcholine receptor antibody-positive, regardless of prior treatments.
    • The primary endpoint will be the change in a scale called MG-ADL from baseline to week 12. After the trial ends, participants will have the option to enroll in an open-label long-term extension study.
    • Ra says zilucoplan is a synthetic macrocyclic peptide that binds to complement component 5 (C5), inhibiting its cleavage into C5a and C5b. It is designed to disrupt the interaction between C5b and C6 and prevent assembly of the membrane attack complex which causes the breakdown of red blood cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
